channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for KY
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for KY

item.title: Report X-2024010481
item.description:
Report X-2024010481

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-23T15:11:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-10
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: AT THE UPS WORLDPORT FACILITY IN LOUISVILLE KENTUCKY, RESPONDED TO AN AIR PACKAGE GOING TO HAWAII THAT WAS BEING REPACKED AFTER BEING WET FROM RAINWATER. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED (1) 5.25 KG PLASTIC TUB OF CORROSIVE RATIONAL CLEANER TABS. THE INNER PLASTIC CONTAINER HAS A BLACK AND WHITE LIMITED QUANTITY MARK IMPRINTED ON THE CONTAINER. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER FIBERBOARD BOX. THIS PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM NEW YORK USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER 150479, KEREKES BAKERY EQUIP, 6103 15TH AVE., BROOKLYN NY 11219-5402.

item.title: Report E-2024010359
item.description:
Report E-2024010359

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-22T15:12:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-04
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported there was a drum with moisture on the outside on the dock in Louisville, KY. It is a 55 gallon metal drum containing Primary Amel Acetate, which was found on the dock "sweating" but with no signs of visible damage on the container. The caller stated there was no active leak. The drum was not packaged correctly. The SDS was reviewed with the terminal, who stated they overpacked the drum in an 85 gallon poly drum and it was left in the waste area to be managed by the terminal.

item.title: Report X-2024010478
item.description:
Report X-2024010478

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-19T15:12:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-11
  • City: INDEPENDENCE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was brought to QA's area due to it leaking. Once it was inspected for a normal DPR it was found that the product inside the package was actually a hazmat. Once it was determined that that product inside was a hazmat the package was put into a lined tote and taken to the hazmat cage. DescribePack: Cap came loose during transit causing internal leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Cap was tightened and package was kept in an upright position in a lined tote.

item.title: Report X-2024010226
item.description:
Report X-2024010226

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-18T15:13:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-20
  • City: INDEPENDENCE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Drum was brought to QA by a tugger driver due to it leaking, DescribePack: Drum head was dented causing seal to be loosened and allowing product to leak out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Drum was kept in an upright position and put into a lined tote.

  • Carrier/Reporter: SUPERIOR TRANSPORTATION LOGISTICS LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A cap was left off the tanker after previous unload. When refilled, a small amount of material, <5gallons, was released from opening and immediately caught. Material was promptly cleaned up. Cap was reinstalled.

item.title: Report X-2024010221
item.description:
Report X-2024010221

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-20
  • City: INDEPENDENCE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Manager found package on IC belt, package was brought to QA area. No product leaked out of package only on outer packaging. DescribePack: Once package was inspected it was found that a cap came loose causing internal leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Cap was tightened and package was kept in a lined tote.

item.title: Report E-2024010150
item.description:
Report E-2024010150

  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A 1-gallon release of UN1830 "Liquid Fire Drain Line Opener" that was released from (2) 1-gallon poly jugs impacting the dock floor. The jugs were punctured by a forklift. No Drains, Soils or waterways were impacted.

item.title: Report X-2024010437

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Some point during transit the contents caps have came loose causing a leak of cleaner package was found and placed in the hazmat cage for processing. DescribePack: loose caps DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: package was placed in a spillproof tote.
